vision.notes: Likely present in most members, though details of acuity and color vision are unknown at this family level. No information about loss or specialization.

olfaction.notes: Presumed to be well-developed, as with most rodents. Used in foraging, social behavior and predator avoidance.

audition.notes: Hearing is likely important for communication and predator detection. Range data is not available from provided text.

somatosensation.notes: Tactile sense likely well-developed, especially vibrissae for navigating environments. Some species are semiaquatic (Ichthyomys spp.) and may have specialized adaptations.

gustation.notes: Taste is likely present, though specific details are unknown. Given dietary diversity, some specialization may exist.
